title: sections 4, 7, 8, 14 and 14A of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as

text_raw:
1. These regulations may be cited as the Student Support (Amendment) 

Regulations 2024.

title: sections 4, 7, 8, 14 and 14A of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as
heading: In these regulations “Principal Regulations” means the Student Support
text_raw:
2. 

In these regulations “Principal Regulations” means the Student Support 

Regulations 2024 (S.I. No. 104 of 2024).
text_norm: 2 regulation principal regulation mean student support regulation 2024 (s.i no 104 2024)

title: sections 4, 7, 8, 14 and 14A of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as
heading: 3. Regulation 4(b)(i) of the Principal Regulations is amended by
text_raw:
3. Regulation 4(b)(i) of the Principal Regulations is amended by 

substituting the following: 

“(i) a course that takes not less than two years to complete and is provided by an 
approved institution that comes within the terms of section 7(1)(a), (b), (ba) or 
(c) of the Act and is listed in Part A or B of Schedule 1, including courses listed 
in Part D of Schedule 2 which require the successful completion of a course 
listed in Part C of Schedule 2 as a condition of entry;”
text_norm: 3 regulation 4(b)(i) principal regulation amended substituting following (i) course take le two year complete provided approved institution come within term section 7(1)(a) (b) (ba) (c) act listed part b schedule 1 including course listed part schedule 2 require successful completion course listed part c schedule 2 condition entry

title: sections 4, 7, 8, 14 and 14A of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as
heading: 4. Regulation 4(c)(i) of the Principal Regulations is amended by
text_raw:
4. Regulation 4(c)(i) of the Principal Regulations is amended by 

substituting the following: 

“(i) takes not less than 2 years to complete, including courses listed in Part D of 
Schedule 2 which require the successful completion of a course listed in Part C 
of Schedule 2 as a condition of entry;”
text_norm: 4 regulation 4(c)(i) principal regulation amended substituting following (i) take le 2 year complete including course listed part schedule 2 require successful completion course listed part c schedule 2 condition entry

title: sections 4, 7, 8, 14 and 14A of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as
heading: 5. Part C of Schedule 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting
text_raw:
5. Part C of Schedule 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting 

after 

“Ballyfermot College of Further Education 

In respect of years 1 and 2 of the following courses: 

— BBs (Hons) in Business and Psychology 

— BA (Honours) in Immersive Media Production” 

the following text: 

“City of Dublin ETB, Cathal Brugha Street 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 1st November, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [590] 3 

In respect of years 1 and 2 of the following course: 

— Bachelor of Arts (Honours) in Digital and Business Skills (DABS)”
text_norm: 5 part c schedule 2 principal regulation amended inserting ballyfermot college education respect year 1 2 following course -- bb (hons) business psychology -- ba (honours) immersive medium production following text city dublin etb cathal brugha street notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 1st november 2024 590 3 respect year 1 2 following course -- bachelor art (honours) digital business skill (dabs)

title: sections 4, 7, 8, 14 and 14A of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as
heading: 6. Part D of Schedule 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting
text_raw:
6. Part D of Schedule 2 of the Principal Regulations is amended by inserting 

after 

“In respect of years 3 and 4 of the following courses: 

— Bachelor of Science (Hons) in Software Development 

— BA (Hons) in Animation, Visual Effects and Motion Design” 

the following text: 

“National College of Ireland – Dublin 

In respect of years 3 and 4 of the following course: 

— Bachelor of Arts (Honours) in Digital and Business Skills (DABS)”
text_norm: 6 part schedule 2 principal regulation amended inserting respect year 3 4 following course -- bachelor science (hons) software development -- ba (hons) animation visual effect motion design following text national college ireland - dublin respect year 3 4 following course -- bachelor art (honours) digital business skill (dabs)

title: sections 4, 7, 8, 14 and 14A of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as
heading: 7. These Regulations shall be deemed to have come into operation on 22
text_raw:
7. These Regulations shall be deemed to have come into operation on 22 

March 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [590] 

The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform consents to the making of the foregoing Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

30 October, 2024. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

31 October, 2024. 

PATRICK O’DONOVAN, 

Minister for Further and Higher Education, Research, 
Innovation and Science. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [590] 5
text_norm: 7 regulation shall deemed come operation 22 march 2024 4 590 minister public expenditure national development plan delivery reform consent making foregoing regulation given official seal 30 october 2024 paschal donohoe minister public expenditure national development plan delivery reform given official seal 31 october 2024 patrick donovan minister higher education research innovation science 590 5

title: sections 4, 7, 8, 14 and 14A of the Student Support Act 2011 (No. 4 of 2011) (as
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations are an amendment to the existing principal Regulations (S.I. 
No. 104 of 2024) which prescribe "approved institutions" and other matters for 
the purposes of the Student Support Act 2011. These Regulations may be cited 
as the Student Support (Amendment) Regulations 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [590]
